body:
You already can, it just more verbose
```rs
app.world_mut().add_observer(some_observer).insert(Name::new("Some observer"));
```

Could the observer fn have a require attribute like components do? Would be a lot more versatile, like for marker components.

```rs
#[require(Name::new("FooObserver"))]
fn observer(trigger: Trigger<Foo>) {}
```

This would be inherently solved by moving to a component-driven API (the current system _uses_ components, but spawning observers directly currently involves more work than necessary when they target a given entity). Given that we plan to go that route, I think we should just wait. Then we can just do this:

```rust
world.spawn(
  Thing,
  observers![
    (Observer::new(...), Name::new("Thing Observer"))
  ]
)
```

Also for global observers you can already do this, as `app.add_observer` is just sugar for spawning an entity with an observer component:

```rust
world.spawn((Observer::new(...), Name::new("Thing Observer"))
```

For `.add_observer`, the solution is almost trivial.

For `.observe` it's a little more verbose because you need to add a target and can only spawn on Commands or RelatedSpawnerCommands

issue.body:
# Objective

Closes #18726 

## Solution

- Add `add_named_observer` to `App` and `World`
- Add `observe_named` to `EntityCommands` and `EntityWorldMut`

## Showcase

```rust
commands.spawn_empty().observe_named(my_observer, "MyObserver");
world.entity(entity).observe_named(my_observer, "MyObserver");
world.add_named_observer(my_observer, "MyObserver");
app.add_named_observer(my_observer, "MyObserver");
```

## TODO

- [ ] Maybe rename `add_named_observer`
- [ ] Maybe rename `observe_named`
- [ ] Maybe add names to some of built-in observers
